title: Interrupt (ctrl+c) or soft kill process never exits.
body:
I will sit at this point for hours and never go anywhere else. End up having to ctrl+c panic 9 more times to exit. Any suggestions on how to properly stop the process?

**Version**
```
/home/erigon/erigon/build/bin/erigon -v
erigon version 2.49.0-dev-8983128d
```

**Command**
#bin/bash
```
/home/erigon/erigon/build/bin/erigon \
--chain=mainnet \
--torrent.upload.rate="1024mb" \
--torrent.download.rate="1024mb" \
--datadir="$(eval echo ~$USER)/erigon-eth" \
--internalcl \
--chain=mainnet \
--port=30501 \
--http.port=9201 \
--authrpc.port=9101 \
--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \
--authrpc.vhosts=* \
--torrent.port=42501 \
--private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9090 \
--nat="extip:$(curl -s ifconfig.me)" \
--http \
--http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool \
--ws \
--ws.compression
```



I did fix similar error in last release. Need to check again. Will be useful if you show output after 10 Ctrl+c
It's a massive stack trace; I will post as much as I can. Probably 1000+ goroutines.
